annotation.spannedText: this often-repeated mantra that vaccines were key in the decline of infectious disease deaths is a fallacy

annotation.spannedText: the data

annotation.spannedText: this erroneous belief has led people to trust in vaccination as the sole way to handle infectious diseases when there were clearly other factors that caused mortality to decline

annotation.spannedText: Very little of the improvement in the death rate had anything to do with medicine

annotation.spannedText: medical measures (both chemotherapeutic and prophylactic) appear to have contributed little to the overall decline in mortality in the United States since about 1900—having in many instances been introduced several decades after a marked decline had already set in and having no detectable influence in most instances
